page.title: 01Hamlet of Bale
page.content: Well wooded arable land predominantly wheat, barley, sugar beet and potatoes. Very few livestock. Much of land owned by an insurance company pension fund. Three small very pretty villages with mainly flintstone cottages some used as second homes and very little modern development. One ilometre square contains no buildings and area sparsely populated. Area crossed by main midlands to cromer road, A. 148, and well served by country lanes, bridlepaths and footpaths. A general lack of amenities. No schools or shops or post office or public house. About four miles from nearest town. Villages served by community minibus ervice pioneered here. Mostly retired people. Little employment available other than agriculture. No rereational facilities. Land comparatively high
